intro: Aspidixia angulata, commonly known as the angular aspidixia, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is native to southern Africa, where it typically grows in grassy areas and rocky outcrops. The plant features slender, angular stems and finely divided, feather-like leaves that contribute to its ornamental appeal. Its small white or yellowish flowers are clustered in umbrella-like structures, typical of the carrot family. Aspidixia angulata is often cultivated for its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
